pullRequest.title: Paged Job Controller
pullRequest.bodyText: Opening this as a draft to help myself keep track of the work that's been done and still needed.

commit.message: Fix(AlertPagedModel): Begin refactoring in preperation for paging support
Refactor(JobAccessor): Split out job-related methods from ConfigurationAccessor to JobAccessor
Feat(JobAccessor): Implement paged query for jobs
Feat(JobConfigActions): Add validation to job paged request
Fix(JobConfigController): Add basic interface for paging with controllers and remove getAll endpoint
Fix(JobAccessor): Update job query to account for descriptor permissions
Add FIXMEs for things that require paging
Feat(UI): Add paging to jobs table

nodes.bodyText: Create a ticket to do this more efficiently by passing all of the relevant job ids.
Seems like these are duplicate lines.

commit.message: Fix(Paging): Clean up some TODOs and FIXMEs
Fix(Jobs): Change job table validation to only validate jobs being displayed (instead of all jobs)
Fix(Job Validation): Add new query to make job-name-uniqueness check more efficient

nodes.bodyText: This will be handled in the "search" changes.

commit.message: Fix(JobConfigActions): Remove FIXME comment that was already resolved

nodes.bodyText:
By the name of this I thought this was the validation result of the jobs.  Can we make a slight change to make it clear this is to be used with a request.
For example: JobsIdsValidationRequestModel

commit.message: Refactor(Job Model): Rename model to include 'response' in its name

nodes.bodyText: isn't 10 a little low? I feel we should be able to get at least 100 items a page rather quickly
Should we be using the jetbrains nullable?

commit.message: Refactor(Annotation): Use JetBrains Nullable to conform to convention

nodes.bodyText: Are these TODOs? If so, we should add that. If they are meant to be empty for now, you should be able to put an empty function directly into wherever they are used.
Are these for the next major version? Since people are using our API, won't this break things for them?
